alert.note: Alert for Edwards (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 12:32PM CST until January 15 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST MONDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing fog/drizzle. Total ice accumulations up to one-tenth of an inch. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 above zero. * WHERE...Edwards County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST Monday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 10 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, especially bridges and overpasses. The hazardous conditions will likely impact the morning commute. Bitterly cold wind chills creating dangerous conditions on exposed skin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lowest wind chills are expected Tuesday morning. Areas of Edwards County may see the wind chills dip below zero degrees, and may need the issuance of a Wind Chill Warning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state can be obtained at drivetexas.org.
